subject: Real Estate
title: Evergrande's Unfinished Empire
description: A short lesson to help you apply Evergrande's Unfinished Empire.

hook.text: China's Evergrande sold apartments that didn't exist yet, collected the money, and couldn't finish building them.

buildup.text: The company grew to $300 billion in debt by pre-selling millions of apartments and borrowing against future sales.

discovery.text: When China tightened lending rules in 2020, Evergrande's cash flow collapsed almost overnight.

twist.text: An estimated 1.6 million families had paid for homes that were now unfinished concrete shells.

climax.text: Evergrande's default was the largest in Chinese corporate history and shook global financial markets.

punchline.text: Millions paid for homes that were never built.

quiz.question: What caused Evergrande's collapse?
options: China tightened lending rules, cutting off cash flow
